items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Physical Natural Gas Steps Back as Winter Loses Its Bite
items.summary: Day-ahead natural gas prices retreated on Tuesday as weather threats receded.

items.title: Futures Settle: Natural Gas Price Bulls Unable to Muster Momentum as Heating Demand Dwindles
items.summary: Natural gas futures floundered for a second day this week as traders braced for spring weather and rapidly receding storage withdrawals.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Spot Prices Slip on Easing Demand
items.summary: Physical natural gas pricing in the day-ahead market weakened on Tuesday with seasonally mild weather on tap for most of the country over the next few days.

items.title: U.S. LNG Exports Continue to Surge 10 Years After Lower 48’s First Cargo Set Sail
items.summary: Wednesday marked 10 years since the first LNG was exported from the Lower 48, a stretch of time that has realigned global energy flows and transformed the United States into the world’s leading producer of the super-chilled fuel.

items.title: Vaca Muerta Drives Argentina Natural Gas Surge as FLNG Plans Accelerate
items.summary: Argentina is on pace to reach production highs this year and is set to “reshape natural gas markets in the region,” according to analysts at Fitch Ratings.

items.title: Latest Storage Week Sees Natural Gas Power Burns Fall to Eight-Week Low on ‘Blowtorch’ Weather
items.summary: Natural gas demand tumbled during the latest storage week as unseasonably mild weather slashed power and heating loads, setting the stage for a light withdrawal in Thursday’s U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) report.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Bullish Natural Gas Catalysts Proving Elusive as March Expiration Nears
items.summary: With a day to go before the March Nymex contract’s final settlement, natural gas futures struggled to find their footing through midday Tuesday amid mostly bearish demand and supply indicators.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Natural Gas Cash Eases as East Warms Up
items.summary: Natural gas physical markets were trading lower early Tuesday, with Henry Hub next-day spot hovering around $3.000/MMBtu as near-record LNG exports offset milder weather forecasts.

items.title: BP Pushes Trinidad Gas Projects as U.S. Licenses Open Door to Venezuela
items.summary: BP plc. executives highlighted advances at their Trinidad gas assets in a recent earnings conference call, citing Cypre among the seven major projects brought online in 2025.

items.title: Canada’s Oil Patch Swept Up in Record $38B Consolidation Wave
items.summary: Previously, we reported that the U.S. Shale Patch has witnessed a big slump in corporate buyouts in recent years as premium acreage depletes and volatile energy prices keep buyers on the sidelines. Following a record $192 billion in mergers and acqui

items.title: Carbon Credits Helped Power the “100% Clean” Olympic Winter Games
items.summary: The Winter Olympics are over, but their energy supplier, Enel, is rightly proud of the feat it pulled off: 100% low-carbon electricity supply for the games. But there is a twist. That 100% was only possible thanks to one thing: carbon credits. The en

items.title: How the EU Could Unlock 22 Trillion Cubic Feet of Barents Gas
items.summary: A rethink of the European Union’s (EU) Arctic policy could keep Norway’s Barents Sea gas in play in the 2030s, offering Europe a nearby, low-emission supply option as its reliance on the global liquefied natural gas market grows, according to new Rys

items.title: Pipeline Disruption Adds Risk Premium to Russian Crude
items.summary: Russia’s pipeline operator Transneft has cut crude intake into its system by roughly 250,000 barrels per day after damage at the Kaleykino pumping station in Tatarstan, according to Reuters sources. Kaleykino is a key blending and dispatch hub that c

items.title: Nigeria to Launch Exports of New Crude Grade as It Boosts Output
items.summary: Nigeria will launch exports of a new crude grade in March as OPEC’s biggest African oil producer looks to boost output and exports and seek a higher baseline in the OPEC+ agreements. The national oil company of Nigeria will start shipping the Cawthor

items.title: The AI Boom Is Powering a Nuclear Renaissance
items.summary: For years, Silicon Valley took electricity for granted. The cloud sounded intangible, almost detached from the physical world. But now, artificial intelligence is ending that illusion. Behind every large language model and AI assistant sits a growing
